alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Calhoun; Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 6:32AM CDT until July 03 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Bradley County in southeastern Arkansas... Southern Calhoun County in southwestern Arkansas... Southern Ouachita County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 930 AM CDT. * At 632 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stephens, Louann, Moro Bay, Moro Bay State Park, Hilo, Ingalls, Artesian, Millers Bluff, Jersey, Standard Umpstead, Cross Roads in Ouachita County, Marsden, Frenchport, Kirkland, Elliot, Vick, Blanchton and Johnsonville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
